key_points: NBC's Peacock streaming service will air 'The Murder of Gabby Petito: Truth, Lies and Social Media' documentary on Friday.
The documentary will feature Gabrielle “Gabby” Petito's life, disappearance, and death, offering insights from her parents and stepparents.
Never-before-seen photos and stories of Petito's life will be shared in the documentary.
The documentary includes coverage by reporters who followed the case, including Herald-Tribune reporter Patricia McKnight.
Petito's stepfather, Jim Schmidt, is featured in the documentary, describing the situation as every parent's nightmare.
Gabby Petito's story became globally noted following her disappearance during a cross-country trip with her fiancé Brian Laundrie.
Petito's body was discovered in Grand Teton National Park; she was determined to have died by strangulation.
Brian Laundrie, the primary person of interest in Petito's disappearance, was found deceased in a Florida nature preserve, with his death ruled a suicide.
The documentary will also explore the significant role that social media investigators played in the case.
The tragic story will be recounted through the perspectives of Petito's family and journalistic accounts.
